data.title: Implement: new github actions to google cloud workflow with successful deployment branching
data.description:
## Overview

This PR migrates the deployment infrastructure from Vercel to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and implements comprehensive deployment branching for both production and preview environments.

## What Was Changed

### Before (Vercel-based)
- Single deployment target (Vercel)
- Limited branching strategy
- No containerized deployments
- Simplified but less scalable architecture

### After (Google Cloud-based)
- **Containerized Deployments**: Docker images built and deployed to Google Cloud Run
- **Artifact Registry**: Container image storage and management
- **Deployment Branching**: Separate workflows for production and preview deployments
- **Infrastructure as Code**: Comprehensive GitHub Actions workflows for CI/CD

## Key Achievements

### 1. Production Deployment Pipeline
- **Workflow**: `deploy-api.production.main.yml`
- **Trigger**: Pushes to `main` branch
- **Target**: Cloud Run service with predictable naming (`dottie-api-main`)
- **Features**: 
  - Automated testing before deployment
  - Container image building and pushing
  - Health checks and validation
  - CORS configuration testing

### 2. Branch Preview Deployments
- **Workflow**: `deploy-api.production.branch.yml`
- **Trigger**: Pull requests and feature branches
- **Target**: Dynamic Cloud Run services (`api-{branch-name}`)
- **Features**:
  - Automatic cleanup of existing services
  - Branch-specific URLs for testing
  - Same validation as production

### 3. Service Account Security
- **Created**: `github-actions-deploy@dottie-app-37930.iam.gserviceaccount.com`
- **Permissions**: Least-privilege access for deployment operations
- **Authentication**: Service account key-based (replacing Workload Identity Federation)

### 4. Comprehensive Validation
- **GCP Authentication**: Multi-step verification of credentials and project access
- **API Enablement**: Automatic enabling of required Google Cloud APIs
- **Container Registry**: Artifact Registry setup and permission testing
- **Deployment Health**: Endpoint testing and CORS validation

### 5. GitHub Actions Integration
- **Secrets Management**: Streamlined secret requirements (`GCP_SA_KEY`)
- **Removed Dependencies**: Eliminated unnecessary GitHub token validation
- **Error Handling**: Robust error detection and reporting
- **Parallel Execution**: Optimized workflow performance

## Technical Benefits

### Scalability
- Container-based architecture supports horizontal scaling
- Cloud Run's serverless model handles traffic spikes automatically
- Artifact Registry provides reliable image storage and versioning

### Development Workflow
- **Preview Deployments**: Every PR gets its own deployment URL
- **Testing**: Automated testing in CI/CD pipeline
- **Validation**: Comprehensive health checks before deployment completion

### Monitoring & Debugging
- Detailed logging throughout deployment process
- Clear error messages with actionable troubleshooting
- Health endpoint validation ensures deployments are functional

## Deployment Architecture

```
GitHub Repository (PR/Push)
    ‚Üì
GitHub Actions Workflow
    ‚Üì
Google Cloud Build
    ‚Üì (Docker Image)
Artifact Registry
    ‚Üì (Deploy Image)
Google Cloud Run
    ‚Üì (Live Service)
Public URL
```

## Workflow Files Added/Modified

1. **`deploy-api.production.main.yml`** - Production deployments
2. **`deploy-api.production.branch.yml`** - Preview deployments  
3. **`project-config.yml`** - Centralized configuration
4. **Load-config action** - Reusable configuration loading

## Security Improvements

- **Service Account Isolation**: Dedicated service account for deployments
- **Minimal Permissions**: Only required GCP roles assigned
- **Secret Management**: Reduced secret requirements
- **Authentication Validation**: Multi-step verification process

## Environment Support

### Production Environment
- **URL Pattern**: `https://dottie-api-main.{region}.run.app`
- **Deployment**: Automatic on main branch
- **Configuration**: Production-optimized settings

### Preview Environment  
- **URL Pattern**: `https://api-{branch-name}.{region}.run.app`
- **Deployment**: Automatic on PR creation/updates
- **Configuration**: Development-friendly settings

## Migration Impact

This change represents a significant infrastructure upgrade:
- **From**: Simple Vercel deployment
- **To**: Enterprise-grade Google Cloud deployment with full CI/CD

The new system provides better scalability, monitoring, and development workflow while maintaining the same application functionality for end users.

data.description:
# Add GitHub Pull Request Habit Tracker Component

## Summary

This PR implements a GitHub-style pull request habit tracker component that displays a year-long contribution calendar, similar to GitHub's contribution graph. The component integrates with the existing pull request feed page and connects to the habit tracker API backend.

## Key Features

- **GitHub-style contribution calendar** with year-long grid view showing daily PR activity
- **Color-coded contribution levels** (5 intensity levels from gray to dark green)
- **Interactive year selector** allowing users to view different years
- **Real-time statistics** displaying total contributions, current streak, longest streak, and daily average
- **Refresh functionality** to sync latest data from GitHub API
- **Responsive design** with mobile-first approach and dark mode support
- **Comprehensive error handling** and loading states

## Technical Implementation

### Frontend Components
- **`HabitTracker.tsx`** - Main React component implementing the contribution calendar
- **Calendar algorithm** - Generates year-long grid layout with proper week/month positioning
- **API integration** - Connects to habit tracker backend endpoints
- **TypeScript interfaces** - Proper typing for API responses and component props

### Integration Points
- **Pull Request Feed Page** - Added habit tracker above existing PR feed
- **Existing API Backend** - Utilizes the habit tracker endpoints from previous implementation
- **Design System** - Matches existing Tailwind CSS styling and dark mode themes

### Testing Coverage
- **Unit Tests** - Component behavior, API integration, user interactions
- **Integration Tests** - Full API flow, data handling, error scenarios
- **End-to-End Tests** - Complete user journey, visual validation, responsive design

## Files Added

```
apps/web/src/components/pull-request-feed/components/HabitTracker.tsx
apps/web/src/components/pull-request-feed/components/__tests__/HabitTracker.test.tsx
integration/pull-request-feed/HabitTracker.integration.test.tsx
e2e/tests/features/pull-request/habit-tracker.web.spec.ts
```

## Files Modified

```
apps/web/docs/pull-request-feed.mdx - Added HabitTracker component import and usage
apps/web/jest.config.ts - Fixed setup files configuration
apps/web/src/tests/setupTests.ts - Added testing-library/jest-dom import
apps/web/babel.config.js - Added for Jest compatibility
```

## API Integration

The component integrates with the existing habit tracker API endpoints:

- `GET /api/github/habit-tracker/stats` - Retrieves contribution statistics
- `GET /api/github/habit-tracker/entries` - Fetches daily contribution data
- `POST /api/github/habit-tracker/refresh` - Triggers data refresh from GitHub

## Visual Design

The component matches GitHub's contribution graph design:
- **Calendar grid layout** with months across the top and days of week on the left
- **Color intensity levels** representing contribution frequency (0, 1, 2-3, 4-5, 6+ PRs)
- **Legend** showing "Less" to "More" contribution levels
- **Statistics panel** displaying key metrics and streak information

## User Experience

- **Intuitive navigation** with year selector dropdown
- **Hover tooltips** showing exact dates and contribution counts
- **Loading states** during API calls
- **Error recovery** with retry functionality
- **Responsive behavior** adapting to different screen sizes

## Test Coverage

### Unit Tests
- Component rendering and state management
- API integration and error handling
- User interactions (year selection, refresh)
- Calendar grid generation and display

### Integration Tests
- Full API workflow testing
- Data transformation and display
- Error scenario handling
- Environment-specific configurations

### End-to-End Tests
- Complete user journey validation
- Visual layout verification
- Interactive controls functionality
- Mobile responsiveness testing

## Deployment Ready

- **Build verification** - Successfully compiles with existing codebase
- **Type safety** - Full TypeScript implementation with proper interfaces
- **Performance optimized** - Efficient calendar generation and API calls
- **Accessibility** - Semantic HTML and keyboard navigation support

## Screenshots

The implementation matches the provided GitHub contribution graph design with:
- Year-long calendar view
- Color-coded contribution squares
- Month and day labels
- Statistics display
- Interactive controls

## Future Enhancements

- **Streak badges** for milestone achievements
- **Weekly/monthly views** for different time perspectives
- **Contribution trends** with comparative analytics
- **Export functionality** for sharing progress

data.title: :sparkles: Add version locking feature to prevent accidental deletion
data.description:
## Summary

This PR implements a comprehensive version locking system that allows users to lock their saved versions to prevent deletion by other team members. The enhancement was requested on #6763

### Key Features
- ‚úÖ Only version creators can lock/unlock their own versions
- ‚úÖ Locked versions cannot be deleted by anyone except the creator  
- ‚úÖ System snapshots cannot be locked (only user-created versions)
- ‚úÖ Clear visual indicators and menu options in the UI
- ‚úÖ Comprehensive authorization checks and error handling

### Backend Changes
- **Database Migration**: Added `locked_by` column to `file_change` table with proper indexing
- **New RPC Endpoints**: 
  - `lock-file-snapshot` - Lock a version (creator only)
  - `unlock-file-snapshot` - Unlock a version (creator only)
- **Enhanced Security**: Updated `delete-file-snapshot` with lock protection
- **Authorization**: Proper permission checks and descriptive error messages

### Frontend Changes
- **UI Components**: Added lock/unlock actions to version history sidebar
- **Visual Indicators**: Clear display of locked status on versions
- **Conditional Menus**: Show lock/unlock options based on current state
- **Data Integration**: Connected to backend RPC commands

### Files Modified
- `backend/src/app/migrations/sql/0140-add-locked-by-column-to-file-change-table.sql` - Database migration
- `backend/src/app/rpc/commands/files_snapshot.clj` - Backend API logic  
- `frontend/src/app/main/data/workspace/versions.cljs` - Frontend data layer
- `frontend/src/app/main/ui/workspace/sidebar/versions.cljs` - UI components

## Manual Testing Instructions

### Prerequisites
1. Set up development environment:
   ```bash
   ./manage.sh start-devenv
   ./manage.sh run-devenv
   ```

2. Apply database migration:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   clojure -M:dev:migrate
   ```

3. Start backend and frontend:
   ```bash
   # Terminal 1: Backend
   cd backend && ./scripts/repl
   
   # Terminal 2: Frontend  
   cd frontend && yarn watch:app
   ```

### Test Scenarios

#### ‚úÖ Basic Lock/Unlock Functionality

**Test 1: Lock Your Own Version**
1. Create/open a file and make changes
2. Go to versions panel (history icon in sidebar)
3. Click "Save Version" to create a user version
4. Click menu (three dots) on your saved version
5. Select "Lock" from dropdown
6. **Expected**: Version shows lock indicator, menu shows "Unlock"

**Test 2: Unlock Version**
1. With a locked version from Test 1
2. Click menu ‚Üí "Unlock"
3. **Expected**: Version unlocked, menu shows "Lock" again

**Test 3: Delete Protection**
1. Lock a version
2. Try to delete it via menu
3. **Expected**: Deletion fails with error message

#### ‚úÖ Multi-User Authorization

**Test 4: Other Users Cannot Delete Locked Versions**
1. User A creates and locks a version
2. User B opens same file
3. User B tries to delete User A's locked version
4. **Expected**: Deletion fails with authorization error

**Test 5: Only Creator Can Lock/Unlock**
1. User A creates version (unlocked)
2. User B tries to lock User A's version
3. **Expected**: Lock fails with "only creator can lock" error

#### ‚úÖ Error Handling

**Test 6: Double Lock Prevention**
1. Lock a version
2. Try to lock it again
3. **Expected**: Fails with "already locked" error

**Test 7: Unlock Non-Locked Version**
1. With unlocked version
2. Try to unlock it
3. **Expected**: Fails with "not locked" error

**Test 8: System Snapshot Protection**
1. Find auto-saved system snapshots (grouped by date)
2. Try to lock a system snapshot
3. **Expected**: Fails with "system snapshots can't be locked" error

#### ‚úÖ UI/UX Verification

**Visual Indicators:**
- [x] Locked versions show lock indicator
- [x] Menu shows "Lock" for unlocked versions
- [x] Menu shows "Unlock" for locked versions
- [x] Lock/unlock options only appear for user versions

**Functionality:**
- [x] Lock/unlock actions work correctly
- [x] Delete prevention works for locked versions
- [x] Only creators can lock/unlock their versions
- [x] System snapshots cannot be locked
- [x] Proper error messages for all failure cases

### Database Verification

Check migration and data integrity:
```sql
-- Verify migration applied
SELECT * FROM file_change WHERE locked_by IS NOT NULL;

-- Check lock status
SELECT id, label, profile_id, locked_by, created_by 
FROM file_change 
WHERE file_id = 'test-file-id' 
AND created_by = 'user';
```

### Browser Testing

1. **Network Tab**: Verify API calls
   - Lock: `POST /api/rpc/command/lock-file-snapshot`
   - Unlock: `POST /api/rpc/command/unlock-file-snapshot`
   - Data: `locked_by` field in responses

2. **Console**: Check for proper error handling
   - No JavaScript errors
   - Descriptive error messages for invalid operations

### Performance Testing

1. Create many versions (locked and unlocked)
2. Verify version list loads quickly
3. Check lock status displays correctly for all versions

## Test Plan

- [x] **Basic functionality**: Lock/unlock own versions
- [ ] **Security**: Cannot lock/unlock others' versions
- [x] **Protection**: Cannot delete locked versions
- [x] **System snapshots**: Cannot be locked
- [x] **Error handling**: All edge cases handled properly
- [ ] **UI/UX**: Clear visual indicators and menu options
- [x] **Performance**: No impact on version list loading
- [x] **Database**: Migration applied correctly
- [x] **Multi-user**: Authorization works across users
